column4: What are the benefits of using a specific driver for an integrated graphics card (let's say i915) over just using xvesa? Not as if you'd need hardware acceleration with that kinda card
one is generic, one is chipset specific
why do you want to remove it all ?
I'm running a laptop, so I don't need printing facilities on it.
I don't really want unused packages taking up diskspace either.
it doesn't take up much, but other applications want the cups system to be there, so keep it simple and just disable it
fair point I guess. How would I go about disabling the daemon?

I perhaps misworded that.. rather doing 'cat [files] > /dev/null' writes the info to the buffers in memory.. Just seems strange to me that the hdd can fall asleep and you can access the file without it waking up again.. Like as if it checks the RAM first, then the hdd
so the harddisk is basically never idle? What process would be writing/reading from disk.. if we discard X for a sec.
